did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Red Dust mss., 1963–2010, consists of the papers and business records of Red Dust Books, including manuscript drafts and proofs, correspondence with authors and translators, and additional book production materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collections is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Created in 1961, Red Dust became dedicated to publishing work thought to be unpublishable because of length, form or content, according to founder, publisher and author Joanna Gunderson. In 1963, Red Dust released its first books: Mathis at Colmar, by Linda Nochlin; and Sights, by Anna Holmes. Over the years Red Dust has published many notable works of international fiction and poetry, including those by French avant-garde writer Robert Pinget, French poet and essayist Francis Ponge, Peruvian poet Antonio Cisneros, Indian poet Maya Khosla, and German poet Eric Fried. English translations for Red Dust Books have been rendered by Maureen Ahern, William Rowe, David Tipton, Bruce Benderson, Patrick Bowles, Lee Fahnestock, Stuart Hood, Ursule Molinaro, and Barbara Wright.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: I. Writings; II. Reviews; III. Correspondence; IV. Financial Records; V. Photographs; VI. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is organized by the following series: I. Writings; II. Reviews; III. Correspondence; IV. Financial Records; V. Photographs; VI. Miscellaneous. Writings are divided into subseries of manuscripts and accompanying materials of, respectively, Joanna Gunderson, Robert Pinget, and Barbara Wright, as well as "Other Works" of additional authors and translators arranged in alphabetical order by last name.

Reviews and Correspondence are also arranged in alphabetical order by name of author or translator. Correspondents include John Calder, Marion Boyars, Isaac Gewirtz, Joanna Gunderson, Mark Insingel, Gunter Kunert, Claude Ollier, Harold Pinter, Sotiris Spatharis, and John Updike. Financial Records include orders, invoices, deposits and royalty statements. The Miscellaneous series includes advertisements, artwork, catalogs, and historical information pertaining to Red Dust Books.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Red Dust mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
